name: Orange Raisin Whole Wheat Bread
description: Orange Raisin Whole Wheat Bread. Moist, dense, healthy, filling and great for the stomach! Great for snacking. Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons orange zest ((i added 1 teaspoon this time, and that wasn't enough))

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the milk and add yeast to it. Mix well and let stand for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the milk and add yeast to it. Mix well and let stand for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan ,add sugar, honey, salt, nutmeg and all purpose flour and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan ,add sugar, honey, salt, nutmeg and all purpose flour and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the milk and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the milk and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the orange juice, raisins, zest and 1 cup whole wheat flour. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the orange juice, raisins, zest and 1 cup whole wheat flour. Mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in 1 cup flour at a time and knead into a soft dough. Use some water if necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in 1 cup flour at a time and knead into a soft dough. Use some water if necessary.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in a well oiled container, covered in a warm oven for about an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in a well oiled container, covered in a warm oven for about an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead the dough again and make into a bread pan loaf.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead the dough again and make into a bread pan loaf.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in the bread pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in the bread pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Place bread pan in warm oven with a container of boiling water for about 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place bread pan in warm oven with a container of boiling water for about 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the bread pan with a disposable lasagna pan deep enough to have a couple of inches above the pan. (I found this tip on another baking blog, to trap the steam and get a great crust)
recipeInstructions.name: Cover the bread pan with a disposable lasagna pan deep enough to have a couple of inches above the pan. (I found this tip on another baking blog, to trap the steam and get a great crust)

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in pre-heated oven at 350 degrees F for about 25 minutes. Remove lasagna pan after the first 10 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in pre-heated oven at 350 degrees F for about 25 minutes. Remove lasagna pan after the first 10 mins.
